info.title: Counterparty Metadata API
info.description: Provides the access and availability to the counterparty metadata API.

get.description: Retrieve information about the other account metadata specified by the ID

400.description: Returned when the request body is malformatted or does not match the expected request.

401.description: Returned when the request does not contains the user's credentials.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to access the resource.

404.description: Returned when the resource is not found.

500.description: Returned when an unexpected error occured on the server side.

CorporateLocation.description: CorporateLocation is the corporate_location metadata made on a other_account.

ImageURL.description: ImageURL is the image_url metadata made on a other_account.

MoreInfo.description: MoreInfo is the more_info metadata made on a other_account.

PrivateAlias.description: PrivateAlias is the private_alias metadata made on a other_account.

PublicAlias.description: PublicAlias is the public_alias metadata made on a other_account.

URL.description: URL is the url metadata made on a other_account.

CorporateLocations.description: CorporateLocations is the list of corporate_locations.

ImageURLs.description: ImageURLs is the list of image_urls.

MoreInfos.description: MoreInfos is the list of more_infos.

OpenCorporatesURLs.description: OpenCorporatesURLs is the list of open_corporates_urls.

PhysicalLocations.description: PhysicalLocations is the list of physical_locations.

PrivateAliases.description: PrivateAliases is the list of private_aliases.

PublicAliases.description: PublicAliases is the list of public_aliases.

URLs.description: URLs is the list of urls.

Latitude.description: The latitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-90.0, +90.0].

Longitude.title: The longitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-180.0, +180.0]

typesLocation.description:
Location is An object representing a latitude/longitude pair. This is expressed as a pair
of doubles representing degrees latitude and degrees longitude.
Values must be within normalized ranges.
Refer to https://godoc.org/google.golang.org/genproto/googleapis/type/latlng.

OAuth2.description: Access to counterparty metadata resources is restricted to authenticated users. The authentication process follows the Authorization Code flow.
